text: Greenock Morton Football Club are a football team, who currently play in the Scottish Championship. The club was founded as Morton Football Club in 1874, making it one of the oldest senior Scottish clubs. Greenock Morton are popularly known as "The Pride of the Clyde", a tradition which pre-dates the club's renaming in 1994 to celebrate the links with its home town of Greenock. The club has a traditional local rivalry with St Mirren F.C.. ==Name== * 1874-1994 Morton F.C. * 1994-present Greenock Morton F.C. ==Honours== ===National honours=== * Scottish Cup ** Winners: 1921–22 ** Runners-up: 1947–48 * Scottish League Cup ** Runners-up: 1963–64 * Scottish Challenge Cup ** Runners-up: 1992 * Scottish Premiership (first tier) ** Runners-up: 1916–17 * Scottish Championship (second tier) ** Champions: (6) 1949–50, 1963–64, 1966–67, 1977–78, 1983–84, 1986–1987 ** Runners-up: (4) 1899–1900, 1928–29, 1936–37, 2012–13 * Scottish League One (third tier) ** Champions: (3) 1994–95, 2006–07, 2014–15 ** Runners-up: 2005–06 * Scottish League Two (fourth tier) ** Champions: 2002–03 ==European record== Season Competition Round Opponent Home Away Aggregate 1968–69 Inter-Cities Fairs Cup First round Chelsea 3–4 0–5 3–9 ==Notes== ==References== Category:Scottish football clubs Category:1874 establishments in Scotland Category:Greenock
title: Greenock Morton F.C.
